nl: Let $X$ be completely regular, let $A$ and $B$ be disjoint closed subsets of $X$. Show that if $A$ is compact, there is a continuous function $f \colon X \rightarrow [0, 1]$ such that $f(A) = \{0\}$ and $f(B) = \{1\}$.
lean:
∀ (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] [CompletelyRegularSpace X]
  (A B : Set X) (hA : IsClosed A) (hB : IsClosed B)
  (hAB : Disjoint A B)
  (hAc : IsCompact A) :
  ∃ (f, X → Icc 0 1), Continuous f ∧ f '' A = {0} ∧ f '' B = {1}
candidate: ∀ {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [T2Space X] [CompactSpace X] {A B : Set X} (hAB : Disjoint A B) (hA : IsClosed A) (hB : IsClosed B) : ∃ (f, C(X, ℝ)), (∀ x ∈ A, f x = 0) ∧ (∀ x ∈ B, f x = 1)
imports:
import Mathlib

open Filter Set TopologicalSpace
open scoped Topology
